lead_paragraph: A former jockey who was paralyzed after falling during a race two years ago has agreed to settle a $10 million lawsuit against the Jockeys’ Guild and two former officials who allowed his health insurance to lapse. Neither the Detroit lawyer Paul Koczkur, who represented the jockey, Gary Birzer, nor the California-based guild disclosed the financial terms of the settlement, which was protected by a confidentiality agreement. Koczkur praised the longtime sports agent Dwight Manley, the new national manager of the Guild, for facilitating the negotiations.
